answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Laboratory normal reference range usually vary from one laboratory to another and the lab report should contain the range your lab uses especially for the blood glucose levels after intake of the glucose solution.  If any of your glucose values are higher than what is listed in the table, you will be diagnosed with gestational diabetes. Based from your result, there seems to be an increase in the initial reading. However, it is best that you discuss the result with your doctor for proper evaluation. Factors such as your medical history, symptoms and other factors . This means that a value that falls outside the normal values may still be normal for you or your lab.Take care and do keep us posted.

question: im a pregnant women at 28th week..i had a GTT  with 100gms of glucose . blood samples were taken before ingestion of glucose and after for every 30 mins for 2 hours.. my fastng showd 116mg/dl against 70-110 mg/dl and 30 ,60,90 mins and 2 hours showed 216,124,128,134 respectively.. nw am i diagonised with diabetes??
title: GTT TEST DURING PREGNANCY
